text: - For Abound Net Zero Management product,

we needed a way to reach
our global customers.
Our current solution was primarily focused

on our US customers, and
so what we needed to do

was extract utility
consumption and emission data
from our customers' utility bills,

and this is a standard classical
machine learning problem
with optical character Rekognition.
As an example, one utility provider
may say "total consumption"

and another utility provider
may say "total usage,"

but they're actually referring
to the same data point.

And so we'd have to
write a specific script
for every single utility provider
for our current customer base
as well as for any future customers,

which ultimately turns
into a scalability problem.
We were able to leverage the combination

of classical machine
learning with generative AI
to be able to solve for this.

And essentially the solution
that we created was leveraging

Amazon Textract to upload our
utility bills and essentially

extract all the textual
information from those.

We took that textual
information and passed it

into a large language model
offered by Amazon Bedrock

to actually be able to
intelligently process that data
and grab those data points for us.

Now that we can extract
their data from their bills

and they can opt into leveraging
Abound Net Zero Management,
they can actually see all the different
analytics and insights that we provide,

ultimately helping them reach
their sustainability goals,

which ties back into Carrier's
main mission of helping

to create a safer, healthier,
and more sustainable world.
(happy music)
